snippet: Leaders in both parties expressed confidence that they would be able to keep the government running.
abstract: Leaders of both parties in Congress agree on more than $1 trillion spending package that will fund most of federal government for rest of fiscal year; House lawmakers also prepare short-term backup measure to avoid government shutdown on Dec 11, if larger bill is not passed by both chambers.

byline.original: By ASHLEY PARKER and JONATHAN WEISMAN

lead_paragraph: Leaders in both parties expressed confidence that they would be able to keep the government running.

headline.main: Congressional Leaders Reach Deal on Spending
headline.print_headline: Congressional Leaders Reach Deal on Spending
